intro: Obione rotundifolia var. rusbyi, commonly known as the Rusby's broadleaf obione, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its round, broad leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
